content:
s that a machine can “never do
anything really new.” This may be parried for a moment with the saw, “There
is nothing new under the sun.” Who can be certain that “original work” that
he has done was not simply the growth of the seed planted in him by teach-
ing, or the effect of following well-known general principles. A better variant
of the objection says that a machine can never “take us by surprise.” This
statement is a more direct challenge and can be met directly. Machines take
me by surpr
